column4: guys so it turns out that my friend deleted the whole /log folder in the var directory...so i cant touch it....any help...xserver wont start coz is missing the xorg.0.log file...what canwe do?
create the /var/log folder, then.  Then, try "sudo invoke-rc.d gdm restart".  I don't think he's got to create /var/log/Xorg.0.log
are you trying to do dual-head setup, or what?
well that would be nice...like an extended desktop but if i could get it to work with just one external montior without the laptop monitor that would be fine too
what video chip does yoru laptop have?
btw its a powerpc g3 powerbook...old...and i'm running badger on it...works better
you can setup dual-head without xinerama too.  "man radeon" for details on what options you need
the video card i have is not radeon...its ATI 3drage pro
yes, but if you use the "ati" driver for X.org, you can use radeon options
I dont want to fuck with my xorg.conf file really....is there any other option?
you can simply plug in an external monitor and try hot-switching.  You can also "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" once you've done so.
sorry....what do u mean by hotswitching...would i have to reboot?
I don't have an iBook, but it should have a hotkey combination for switching between LCD and external display
